meanings.definition: A material made from fine fibers of glass.
meanings.sent1: The boat was built using fiberglass for its durability.
meanings.sent2: The window frames were reinforced with fiberglass to make them stronger.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's cape was so strong because it was woven with fiberglass fibers.
meanings.sent4: Her resolve was as tough as fiberglass, unyielding to any challenge.
meanings.sent5: The shimmering fiberglass material caught the sunlight, creating a beautiful effect.

meanings.definition: To insulate or reinforce with fiberglass.
meanings.sent1: The workers fiberglassed the walls to keep the house warm in winter.
meanings.sent2: He fiberglassed the roof to protect it from the harsh weather.
meanings.sent3: The chef joked that he would fiberglass the fridge to keep the food fresh forever.
meanings.sent4: She fiberglassed her heart against further hurt, building emotional barriers.
meanings.sent5: The artist carefully fiberglassed the sculpture, adding strength and resilience to the delicate form.
